de.esoco.lib.expression

Interface Function<I,O>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<I,O>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Action<T>, Action.ThrowingAction<T,E>, BinaryFunction<L,R,O>, BinaryFunction.ThrowingBinaryFunction<L,R,O,E>, BinaryPredicate<L,R>, BinaryPredicate.ThrowingBinaryPredicate<L,R,E>, ElementAccessFunction<E,I,O>, InvertibleFunction<I,O>, ObjectSpaceResolver, ObjectSpaceResolver.DeleteResolver, ObjectSpaceResolver.GetResolver, Predicate<T>, Predicate.ThrowingPredicate<T,E>, ThrowingFunction<I,O>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAction, AbstractBinaryFunction, AbstractBinaryPredicate, AbstractInvertibleFunction, AutomaticType, BinaryFunctionChain, BinaryFunctionChain.LeftFunctionChain, BinaryFunctionChain.RightFunctionChain, BinaryFunctionGroup, BinaryPredicateChain, Cast, ClassPredicate, ClassPredicate.HasBaseClass, ClassPredicate.HasClass, CollectorType, Comparison, Comparison.ElementOf, Comparison.EqualTo, Comparison.GreaterOrEqual, Comparison.GreaterThan, Comparison.LessOrEqual, Comparison.LessThan, Comparison.Matching, Comparison.SameAs, ConstraintType, Conversions.DateToStringConversion, Conversions.StringConversion, CounterType, DualFunctionChain, ExceptionMappingAction, ExceptionMappingBinaryFunction, ExceptionMappingBinaryPredicate, ExceptionMappingFunction, ExtractString, GetElement, GetElement.GetField, GetElement.GetListElement, GetElement.GetMapValue, GetElement.GetRelation, GetElement.GetRelationValue, GetElement.ReadField, Invert, InvokeMethod, JsonBuilder.ConvertJson, ListenerType, ListType, MapType, ObjectSpaceResolver.PutResolver, Print, RelationType, RelationTypeFilter, SetElement, SetElement.SetListElement, SetElement.SetMapValue, SetElement.SetRelationValue, SetType, TimerType
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Function<I,O>
extends java.util.function.Function<I,O>
    Interface for functions that return a value that will be derived from an input value. The generic parameters define the types of the input value (I) and the resulting output value (O). For most implementations the easiest way to implement a function will be to subclass AbstractFunction.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String INPUT_PLACEHOLDER
      The placeholder string that is used to display the input value of a function in the result of the Object.toString() method.

    • Field Detail

      • INPUT_PLACEHOLDER

        static final java.lang.String INPUT_PLACEHOLDER
        The placeholder string that is used to display the input value of a function in the result of the Object.toString() method.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        O evaluate(I rValue)
        Evaluates the function on the input value and returns the resulting value. The declaration of this method does not contain a throws clause to make the execution of standard functions as simple as possible. In cases where a function implementation needs to signal a checked exception it should wrap it in an FunctionException which is a subclass of RuntimeException. In such a case the possibility of the occurrence of such exceptions should be documented appropriately in the function documentation.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The input value of the function
        Returns:
        The resulting (output) value (may be NULL)

      • andFinally

        default Action<I> andFinally(Action<O> fAction)
        Creates an action that consumes the result of evaluating an input value.
        Parameters:
        fAction - The action that consumes the function result
        Returns:
        A new action (and Consumer) for input values of this function

      • from

        default <T> Function<T,O> from(Function<T,? extends I> fPrevious)
        Returns a new function object that evaluates the result received from another function with this function.
        Parameters:
        fPrevious - The function to produce this function's input values with
        Returns:
        A new instance of FunctionChain

      • getToken

        default java.lang.String getToken()
        Returns the token that describes this function instance. The default implementation returns the simple name of the function class.
        Returns:
        The function token

      • is

        default <T extends I> Predicate<T> is(Predicate<? super O> pCriteria)

        Returns:

        default <T> Function<I,T> then(Function<? super O,T> fNext)
        Returns a new function object that evaluates the result of this function with another function and returns the result.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
